<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Living Monolith Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=888) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [World Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=6) pg. 59 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) The Prerequisites entry for Living Monolith Dedication  is “Osiriani language, trained in Crafting” rather than “Ancient Osiriani and Sphinx languages, trained in Crafting.”_

**Archetype** [Living Monolith](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=16)

**Prerequisites**
[Ancient Osiriani](/Languages.aspx?ID=40) and [Sphinx](/Languages.aspx?ID=35) languages; Trained in [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4)

**Access**
You are from the Golden Road region.

</column>

---

You’ve begun to inscribe a magical stone called a _ka stone_ that you will some day tie to your soul. You gain knowledge of Ancient Osirion and a connection to your nascent _ka stone_. If you fail a recovery check while [dying](/Conditions.aspx?ID=11), your dying condition does not increase; if you critically fail, your dying condition increases by only 1. You become trained in Ancient Osirion [Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8), or expert if you were already trained.

**Special** You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the living monolith archetype.

<title level="2">Living Monolith Dedication leads to...</title>
[Ka Stone Ritual](/Feats.aspx?ID=889)
